_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Miscellaneous Durable Goods Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

ColArt Americas, Inc. has developed a written accidental release prevention program under the New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection's (NJDEP) Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act (TCPA) Program.  This written program establishes safety procedures associated with the covered dimethyl ether storage process at the facility. 

Stationary source and regulated substances handled:

Storage/distribution of aerosol paint containing dimethyl ether. The ColArt facility, located in Piscataway, New Jersey, is an artist paint and supply storage and distribution warehouse which receives, stores and packages for shipment, various art supplies including small containers, i.e. spray cans, tubes of artist paints and other art based supplies.  Facility operations do not include bulk liquid paint handling, piping, or pumping operations and no large paint containers are handled or stored.  The aerosols are flammable and contain methyl ether which is used as a propellant. 

General accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention tips:

The aerosol products that contain dimethyl ether are stored in a caged, sprinklered area in corrugated boxes on pallets.  The facility has established accidental release prevention program procedures under the NJDEP TCPA program.  

Five-year accident history:

There have been no accidents or releases in the past five-years that meet the accident history criteria.

Emergency Response Program:

In an emergency ColArt employees will not perform emergency response activities. The facility's alarm system (maintained by Tyco Security) would alert the fire department.  The Bureau of Fire Prevention (Piscataway, NJ) has inspected the facility. 

Planned changes to improve safety:

Changes to procedures were identified in the recent compliance audit on 7/27/17 and are planned to be implemented over the course of the next year. 



Reason for Submission:

The revised OCA i

ncluded in this voluntary update is due to a revised analysis, not a change to the process.  The worst-case scenario in this submittal considers a release from the largest vessel on-site containing the regulated substance.  The largest vessel is a 400-ml aerosol can and contains approximately 200 mL of dimethyl ether.
